summary: In this context, urea is evaluated through the 13C-urea breath test as a diagnostic tool for predicting the success of H. pylori eradication, which is relevant in the treatment of peptic ulcers. The study examines the relationship between the breath test results and various factors, including the type of disease, indicating that urea plays a significant role in assessing treatment outcomes for peptic ulcers associated with H. pylori infection.
